root.title: Reinforcement Learning
root.content:
Reinforcement Learning (RL)

An area of machine learning concerned with how intelligent agents ought to take actions in an environment in order to maximize the notion of cumulative reward. It is a process of learning through trial and error.

quiz.question: What is the main goal of an agent in Reinforcement Learning?

agent.title: Agent & Environment
agent.content:
Agent & Environment

The agent is the learner or decision-maker. The environment is everything the agent interacts with, comprising everything outside the agent.

reward-signal.title: Reward Signal
reward-signal.content:
Reward Signal

A key component of RL, the reward signal is a numerical value that the environment sends to the agent. The agent's sole objective is to maximize the total reward it receives over the long run.

quiz.question: In a chess-playing RL agent, what would be a good example of a final reward signal?
options: A reward for every piece captured
A reward for controlling the center of the board

exploration-exploitation.title: Exploration vs. Exploitation
exploration-exploitation.content:
Exploration vs. Exploitation Trade-off

A fundamental dilemma in RL. The agent must balance between exploiting what it already knows to get rewards, and exploring new actions to potentially discover even better rewards.
